com.mapr.stats.random

Class AbstractBayesianDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mahout.math.jet.random.AbstractDistribution
      • org.apache.mahout.math.jet.random.AbstractContinousDistribution
        • com.mapr.stats.random.AbstractBayesianDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.mahout.math.function.DoubleFunction, org.apache.mahout.math.function.IntFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BetaBinomialDistribution, GammaNormalDistribution

    public abstract class AbstractBayesianDistribution
extends org.apache.mahout.math.jet.random.AbstractContinousDistribution
    Expresses the common characteristics of a two-level distribution in which the higher level distribution describes a prior distribution of parameters for the lower level distribution. Generically speaking, we have \[ \theta ~ p_1(\alpha) \\ x | \theta ~ p_2(\theta) \] Here learning involves computing the posterior distribution of \(\theta \mid x\). Note that \(\theta\) is really a theoretical entity here and isn't really required of an implementation. The only required operations include:
    • nextDouble() Sample \(x\) from the posterior of \(p_2\).
    • nextMean() Sample \(E[x]\) from the posterior of \(p_2\).
    • add() Add a new observation x to define a new posterior distribution.
    • posteriorDistribution() Return a copy of the posterior distribution.
